analyzed: du'ang ma yin zhes pa ni de'i nang du'ang bza' bar ma byed cig pa'o //

original: lhung bzed tshol ba spang ba'o /
analyzed: lhung bzed tshol ba spang ba'o /

original: // / ji ltar byas pas 'thag tu bcug pa'i spang bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: // / ji ltar byas pas 'thag tu bcug pa'i spang bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does one come to abandon what has been woven?

original: rin med par bcol zhing gzhan gyis kyang btags na'o zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: rin med par bcol zhing gzhan gyis kyang btags na'o zhes pa yin te /
translated: The phrase having entrusted it without pay means that if another person also weaves it, it is abandoned.

original: gla ma byin par gnyen ma yin pa'i thag pa 'thag tu bcug pa 'am pho nyas 'thag tu bcug na yang nyes par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gla ma byin par gnyen ma yin pa'i thag pa 'thag tu bcug pa 'am pho nyas 'thag tu bcug na yang nyes par 'gyur ba'o //

original: gzhan gyis bstangs na yang des ma byas pa ma yin zhes pa yin te gzhan dang bsdongs shig 'thag na yang nyes pa rangs par 'gyur ba'o /
analyzed: gzhan gyis bstangs na yang des ma byas pa ma yin zhes pa yin te gzhan dang bsdongs shig 'thag na yang nyes pa rangs par 'gyur ba'o /

original: 'thag tu bcug pa spang ba'o /
analyzed: 'thag tu bcug pa spang ba'o /
translated: The prohibition of causing to weave is finished.

original: // / da ni 'thag pa na skyed pa'i yan lag je ston pa ni /
analyzed: // / da ni 'thag pa na skyed pa'i yan lag je ston pa ni /

original: de'i phyir 'thag na'o zhes pa la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'thag na'o zhes pa la sogs pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, if you weave, etc.

original: dge slong de'i phyir 'thag pa la 'og ma ltar byas na nyes par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: dge slong de'i phyir 'thag pa la 'og ma ltar byas na nyes par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If the monk acts as described below in regard to weaving, there is a fault.

original: thag pa yug khyim che ba dang thags ran bzang bar byed du bcug na'o zhes pa yin te tha ga pa 'di ltar byed du bcug na nyes par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: thag pa yug khyim che ba dang thags ran bzang bar byed du bcug na'o zhes pa yin te tha ga pa 'di ltar byed du bcug na nyes par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If you cause to weave a large piece of cloth with good warp threads, if you cause the weaver to act in this way, there is a fault.

original: gal te sbyin bdag gi gong na'o zhes pa ni sbyin bdag gis dang po ci spags pa las skud pa yang rung rin kyang rung ste bsnan cing lhag par god na nyes par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gal te sbyin bdag gi gong na'o zhes pa ni sbyin bdag gis dang po ci spags pa las skud pa yang rung rin kyang rung ste bsnan cing lhag par god na nyes par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If it is above the patron, if the patron first adds more yarn or more price, and there is an excess, there is a fault.

original: gla ma byin na'o zhes pa ni dge slong gis kha chos bzhin du byas pa las sgron skye ba'i gla thud ma byin na nyes par 'gyur ba'o //üîΩspyin bdag gis de'i phyir bsgo ba med na byed do zhes pa ni tha ga pa'i gan du song la bdag gar dga' ba'i kha chos gyis shig ces dge slong la bsgo pa med pa 'am /
analyzed: gla ma byin na'o zhes pa ni dge slong gis kha chos bzhin du byas pa las sgron skye ba'i gla thud ma byin na nyes par 'gyur ba'o // spyin bdag gis de'i phyir bsgo ba med na byed do zhes pa ni tha ga pa'i gan du song la bdag gar dga' ba'i kha chos gyis shig ces dge slong la bsgo pa med pa 'am /
translated: If one does not pay the weaver for the cloth, one commits an offense, because the monk has acted according to the rules.üîΩIf the patron does not order it, one may do it.

analyzed: tha ga pa la bsgo ba med par dge slong der song zhing kha chos byed na nyes par 'gyur ba'o //

original: gang gi tshe rtsa ba'i nyes par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rtsa ba'i nyes par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: When does one commit a root downfall?üîΩIf it is completed, it is a root downfall.

original: grub na rtsa ba'o zhes pa yin te nam lag tu thob pa'i tshe nyes pa rangs par ston pa'o //
analyzed: grub na rtsa ba'o zhes pa yin te nam lag tu thob pa'i tshe nyes pa rangs par ston pa'o //
translated: If the cloth is completed, the offense is fully explained.

original: de'i phyir 'dri ba cog nyes byas zhes pa ni stan las 'phags pa la sogs pa de'i phyir las su rtsol lo cog bsdus te nyes byas gcig tu ston pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dri ba cog nyes byas zhes pa ni stan las 'phags pa la sogs pa de'i phyir las su rtsol lo cog bsdus te nyes byas gcig tu ston pa'o //

original: ma bsdams par der song ba'ang de bzhin zhes pa ni khyod kyi gos shig 'thag gis der song shig ces @93b yon bdag gis bos pa med par thags ran bzang po 'dod pa'i phyir de'i gan du ni song la kha chos mi byed na yang nyes pa gongüîΩdang 'dra bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: ma bsdams par der song ba'ang de bzhin zhes pa ni khyod kyi gos shig 'thag gis der song shig ces @93b yon bdag gis bos pa med par thags ran bzang po 'dod pa'i phyir de'i gan du ni song la kha chos mi byed na yang nyes pa gong dang 'dra bar ston pa'o //
translated: This shows that if you go to the weaver without being summoned by the patron, saying, ‚ÄúI have cloth to weave, come here,‚Äù and you do not do any spinning, the fault is the same as above.

original: 'thag pa bskyed pa spang ba'o /
analyzed: 'thag pa bskyed pa spang ba'o /
translated: Abandoning the production of cloth.

original: // / yan lag gis 'phrog pa spang ba'i nyes par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: // / yan lag gis 'phrog pa spang ba'i nyes par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If you abandon the production of cloth, you will incur a downfall.üîΩIf you take away the person from whom you are having cloth woven, you will incur a downfall.

original: dge slong las phral na'o zhes pa la sogs pa yin te gang las 'phrog par bya ba'i mi de gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis bsnyen par rdzogs te dge slong yin na nyes par 'gyur ba'o //üîΩbdag gi 'phrog na nyes par 'gyur ram gzhan gyi 'phrog na nyes par 'gyur zhe na /

original: 'phrog pa bdag gim yin na'o zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: 'phrog pa bdag gim yin na'o zhes pa yin te /
translated: If you take away the person from whom you are having cloth woven, do you incur a downfall if you take away the person who belongs to you or if you take away the person who belongs to someone else?üîΩIf the person you take away does not belong to you, you will incur a downfall.

original: bdag gi 'phrog pa lta ci smos kyi gzhan gyis byin pa de'i phyir phrogs na yang nyes par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: bdag gi 'phrog pa lta ci smos kyi gzhan gyis byin pa de'i phyir phrogs na yang nyes par 'gyur ba'o //

original: gzhung las bdag gis byin pa 'phrog na zhes 'byung ba ni gleng gzhi'i tshig tu zad do //

original: de gos yin na'o zhes pa ni gzhan las 'phrog pa de yang nor gzhan ma yin gos yin na gdod nyes par 'gyur ba'o //üîΩlus dang ngag ldan pa 'am gang bas de 'am /
analyzed: de gos yin na'o zhes pa ni gzhan las 'phrog pa de yang nor gzhan ma yin gos yin na gdod nyes par 'gyur ba'o // lus dang ngag ldan pa 'am gang bas de 'am /
translated: If it is cloth, it is a downfall if one steals it from another, but it is not a downfall if it is another kind of wealth.

original: des bsgos pa de'i phyir zhugs na byed do zhes pa ni lus dang ngag gnyi ga ldan pas 'phrog gam lus dang ngag ya re 'phrog gam bdag gis 'phrog gam 'phrog tu bcug kyang rung ste /
analyzed: des bsgos pa de'i phyir zhugs na byed do zhes pa ni lus dang ngag gnyi ga ldan pas 'phrog gam lus dang ngag ya re 'phrog gam bdag gis 'phrog gam 'phrog tu bcug kyang rung ste /
translated: If one steals it with both body and speech, or if one steals it with either body or speech, or if one steals it oneself or if one makes another steal it,

original: yan lag 'di rnams kyis nyes par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: yan lag 'di rnams kyis nyes par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: one commits a downfall by these limbs.

original: yan lag 'di dag ltar ldan pas 'phrog pa gang gi tshe kho na nyes par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: yan lag 'di dag ltar ldan pas 'phrog pa gang gi tshe kho na nyes par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: When one steals with these limbs, when does one commit a downfall?

original: lus las logs shig tu bral bar gyur na mtha'o zhes pa yin te 'phrog pa'i gos de lus las logs shig tu bral bar gyur na gdod ltung bar ston pa'o//
analyzed: lus las logs shig tu bral bar gyur na mtha'o zhes pa yin te 'phrog pa'i gos de lus las logs shig tu bral bar gyur na gdod ltung bar ston pa'o//
translated: This shows that if the garment that was taken is separated from the body, then it is lost.

analyzed: sbyor ba ni nyes byas zhes pa ni nam lus las ma bral gyi bar du spyor ba'o cog nyes byas gcig tu ston pa'o //
translated: The performance is that every time it is used, as long as it is not separated from the body, it is a single offense.

analyzed: 'phrog pa spang bar 'gyur ba de su la spang zhe na /
translated: To whom is the taking of it to be given up?

analyzed: 'di slar sbyin zhes pa yin te su las 'phrog pa de nyid la byin cig pa'o //

translated: If one cuts a single object with many preparations, does one commit a single offense?

original: 'dir dngos po tha mi dad na srun pa re res dbye zhes pa yin te dngos po gcig na yang sta gam la sogs pa bsnun pa re re nyes byas re rer 'gyur bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir dngos po tha mi dad na srun pa re res dbye zhes pa yin te dngos po gcig na yang sta gam la sogs pa bsnun pa re re nyes byas re rer 'gyur bar ston pa'o //
translated: If the object is not different, then each blow is a separate offense. If the object is a single tree, then each blow of the axe and so on is a minor offense.

original: skye yang phyung mtha'o zhes pa ni phyung ste gud du bskyed na /
analyzed: skye yang phyung mtha'o zhes pa ni phyung ste gud du bskyed na /
translated: If one digs up the tree, then one commits a serious offense.

original: mi skam zhing skyer zin gyis kyang phyung ba'i tshe nyams pa'i mthar 'gyur bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: mi skam zhing skyer zin gyis kyang phyung ba'i tshe nyams pa'i mthar 'gyur bar ston pa'o //
translated: The Teacher shows that even if the man is not emaciated and is well-developed, when he pulls out the plant, it will die.

original: nya lcibs dang chu ldum chu las 'phags na de bzhin zhes pa ni 'di dag chu'i nang nas bton na skyer zin gyis kyang bton na nyes par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: nya lcibs dang chu ldum chu las 'phags na de bzhin zhes pa ni 'di dag chu'i nang nas bton na skyer zin gyis kyang bton na nyes par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If the oyster and the water-moss are above the water, it is the same. If these are pulled out of the water, there is an offense even if the man is well-developed.

original: tshi gu ma bcom par mid na phyed du byed ces pa ni shing thog gi tshi gu gud du ril mid byas na yang nyes pa phyed du byas par ston pa'o //
analyzed: tshi gu ma bcom par mid na phyed du byed ces pa ni shing thog gi tshi gu gud du ril mid byas na yang nyes pa phyed du byas par ston pa'o //
translated: If one swallows without breaking the fruit-skin, it is half. This shows that if one swallows the fruit-skin separately, the offense is half.

original: ji ste 'di bcad na legs so zhes zer na bcug pa'i 'o zhes pa ni 'di skad zer na yang gcod du bcug pa'i phyed yin pas na nyes byas su ston pa'o //
analyzed: ji ste 'di bcad na legs so zhes zer na bcug pa'i 'o zhes pa ni 'di skad zer na yang gcod du bcug pa'i phyed yin pas na nyes byas su ston pa'o //
translated: If one says, ‚ÄúIt is good if it is cut,‚Äù it is half of the offense of cutting. This shows that if one says this, it is half of the offense of cutting.

original: 'phrul gyis na phyed pa ma yin rdzu 'phrul gyis bcad pa nyes med par ston pa'o //
analyzed: 'phrul gyis na phyed pa ma yin rdzu 'phrul gyis bcad pa nyes med par ston pa'o //
translated: If it is done by magic, it is not half. This shows that cutting by magic is not an offense.

original: sa bon sa bon gzhan du 'du shes pa ni de bzhin zhes pas sa bon lnga nor te nyams par byas na yang sa bon du 'dra ba'i phyir nyes pa rangs par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: sa bon sa bon gzhan du 'du shes pa ni de bzhin zhes pas sa bon lnga nor te nyams par byas na yang sa bon du 'dra ba'i phyir nyes pa rangs par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If one thinks that the seed is different from the seed, then even if one destroys the five seeds, since they are similar to seeds, the fault is not complete.

original: shun skam dang slang mched pa'i 'dab ma dang me tog rgyas pa dang 'bras bu smin pa rnams phyed nyams pa zhes bya'o zhes pa ni ming gis smos pa 'di dag lta bu nyams par byas na phyed nyams par ston pa'o //
analyzed: shun skam dang slang mched pa'i 'dab ma dang me tog rgyas pa dang 'bras bu smin pa rnams phyed nyams pa zhes bya'o zhes pa ni ming gis smos pa 'di dag lta bu nyams par byas na phyed nyams par ston pa'o //
translated: The dried husk, the sprout, the leaf, the flowering, and the ripening of the fruit are said to be half destroyed. This shows that if one destroys those mentioned by name, it is half destroyed.

original: de dag rang bzhin gyi rtsa ba las ma gyur na ma yin zhes pa ni gong du ming gis smos pa rnams nyams su cha ba'i rkyen ltar ma gyur te rang bzhin ni sngon gyi so na 'dug pa nyes par byas na ni phyed du 'gyur ba maüîΩyin pa'ang ston pa'o //
analyzed: de dag rang bzhin gyi rtsa ba las ma gyur na ma yin zhes pa ni gong du ming gis smos pa rnams nyams su cha ba'i rkyen ltar ma gyur te rang bzhin ni sngon gyi so na 'dug pa nyes par byas na ni phyed du 'gyur ba maüîΩyin pa'ang ston pa'o //
translated: If they do not change from the root nature, it is not. This shows that if the conditions for destroying those mentioned by name above do not occur, the nature remains as before, and if a fault is committed, it becomes half.

original: sa bon du btab pa rtsa ba ma skyes pa'i sa bon ni phyed skyes pa'o zhes pa ni sa bon du btab pa la rtsa ba ma zug pa nyams par byas na phyed skyes pa nyams par byas par ston pa'o //
analyzed: sa bon du btab pa rtsa ba ma skyes pa'i sa bon ni phyed skyes pa'o zhes pa ni sa bon du btab pa la rtsa ba ma zug pa nyams par byas na phyed skyes pa nyams par byas par ston pa'o //
translated: A seed that is planted but whose root has not grown is half-grown. This shows that if one damages a seed that is planted but whose root has not taken hold, one damages a half-grown one.üîΩA sprout, a shoot, a leaf, a flower, and a fruit are different stages of growth. original: pha ba dgo dgo dang sha mo dang sha bal dang bya ma bum dang gos la sogs pa'i rlabs ni 'khrung ba tha dad pa'i phyed do zhes pa ni 'di dag nyams par byas na yang phyed nyams par ston pa'o //

original: // rtsva la sogs pa bcings te 'phongs la mi 'chor ba lta na bcad ces pa ni kun 'joms kyi rtsa ba la @102a * //
analyzed: // rtsva la sogs pa bcings te 'phongs la mi 'chor ba lta na bcad ces pa ni kun 'joms kyi rtsa ba la @102a * //
translated: If grass, etc., is bound and does not fall off the buttocks, it is said to be cut.

original: sogs pa la brtod cing bcings la 'grol ba gzhan med de mi thar na chod cig pa'o //
analyzed: sogs pa la brtod cing bcings la 'grol ba gzhan med de mi thar na chod cig pa'o //
translated: The root of the ku√±a plant, etc., is tied and bound, and there is no other way to release it. If it is not freed, cut it.

original: dge slong mang po zhig de ltar bcings na kun gyis bcad dam zhe na /
analyzed: dge slong mang po zhig de ltar bcings na kun gyis bcad dam zhe na /
translated: If many monks are bound in this way, should they all cut it?

original: gal te du ma na gcig gis so zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te du ma na gcig gis so zhes pa yin te /
translated: If there are many, one should cut it.

original: du ma bcings na gcig gis chod la gzhan khrol cig pa'o //
analyzed: du ma bcings na gcig gis chod la gzhan khrol cig pa'o //
translated: If many are bound, one should cut it. Let the others be free.

original: sa bon du mi rung ba nyes par mi byed ces pa ni 'bras bu ma smin pa ka go na dang lgang srungs lta bu la sogs pa nyams par byas kyang nyes med par ston pa'o //
analyzed: sa bon du mi rung ba nyes par mi byed ces pa ni 'bras bu ma smin pa ka go na dang lgang srungs lta bu la sogs pa nyams par byas kyang nyes med par ston pa'o //
translated: It is said that there is no fault in making seeds unfit, meaning that even if unripe fruits such as bananas and gourds, etc., are damaged, there is no fault.

original: rung bar bya ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: rung bar bya ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is to be made fit?

original: mes reg pa dang tshon dang sen mo dang ne tsos 'tshos ba dang rnyes pa dang byung ba dang grub pa dang gshegs pa dang gtubs pa rnams rung ba'o zhes pa yin te 'di dag ltar byas na rung bar chud pa'o //
analyzed: mes reg pa dang tshon dang sen mo dang ne tsos 'tshos ba dang rnyes pa dang byung ba dang grub pa dang gshegs pa dang gtubs pa rnams rung ba'o zhes pa yin te 'di dag ltar byas na rung bar chud pa'o //
translated: It is suitable to be touched by fire, to be dyed, to be cut by a fingernail, to be pecked by a parrot, to be ground, to be ground again, to be ground still more, to be cut, and to be cut again.

original: brtags pa sa bon du mi rung ba'i drod kyis mi bzung zhes pa ni sa bon du mi rung ba la thug pa'i bar du brtags pa ma yin gyi reg pa tsam gyis chog par ston pa'o //
analyzed: brtags pa sa bon du mi rung ba'i drod kyis mi bzung zhes pa ni sa bon du mi rung ba la thug pa'i bar du brtags pa ma yin gyi reg pa tsam gyis chog par ston pa'o //
translated: It is taught that it is not necessary to examine it until it is unfit to be a seed, but it is sufficient to touch it.

original: 'dir blangs pa yang me'i go zhes pa ni blangs pas phog pa yang mes brtags pa dang 'dra bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir blangs pa yang me'i go zhes pa ni blangs pas phog pa yang mes brtags pa dang 'dra bar ston pa'o //
translated: Here, it is said that even if it is touched, it is like being examined by fire.

original: 'bras bu mes rung bar bya ba ni bsdus pa'i spyi brtsan te yang dag pa'i grangs su'o zhes pa ni dgun lta bu la sogs pa nyag ma re re nas brtags na thogs pa'i phyir spyir brtags pas chog par ston pa'o //

translated: It is taught that it is sufficient to examine the general rule, not each individual grain, such as in winter, because it is difficult to examine each individual grain.

original: bsdus pa'i phyogs gcig tu ba ni 'grub par 'gyur ba ma yin zhes pa ni spyir brtags pa de'ang sa phyogs sam kha 'ga' nas brtags pas mi chog gi kha du ma nas rung bar gyis shig pa'o //üîΩdge slong gis byas pa'ang rung bar byas pa'o zhes pa ni dge slong gis rung bar byas na yang mes rung bar bya ba nyi tshe ma gtogs te gzhan gyis rung bar byas pa rung bar chud pas na dge slong gzhan gyis ni zos kyang bla bar ston
analyzed: bsdus pa'i phyogs gcig tu ba ni 'grub par 'gyur ba ma yin zhes pa ni spyir brtags pa de'ang sa phyogs sam kha 'ga' nas brtags pas mi chog gi kha du ma nas rung bar gyis shig pa'o // dge slong gis byas pa'ang rung bar byas pa'o zhes pa ni dge slong gis rung bar byas na yang mes rung bar bya ba nyi tshe ma gtogs te gzhan gyis rung bar byas pa rung bar chud pas na dge slong gzhan gyis ni zos kyang bla bar ston
translated: The phrase not established in one part means that it is not sufficient to examine the site or a part of it; it should be examined in many places.üîΩThe phrase also established by a monk means that if a monk establishes it, it is established, except for establishing it by fire; it is established by the establishment of another. Therefore, it is taught that it is permissible for another monk to eat it.

original: pa'o // mi rung ba'i sar yang ngo zhes pa ni dge slong gi gnas dang nye gnas tshun chad kyi nang du mes rung bar bya ba ma gtogs pa gzhan gyis rung bar byas kyang bla bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: pa'o // mi rung ba'i sar yang ngo zhes pa ni dge slong gi gnas dang nye gnas tshun chad kyi nang du mes rung bar bya ba ma gtogs pa gzhan gyis rung bar byas kyang bla bar ston pa'o //
translated: The phrase also in an unestablished place means that it is permissible for another monk to eat it, except for establishing it by fire, even if it is established by another, even within the residence and vicinity of a monk.

original: zhag bdun pa dang nam 'tsho ba dang chu bsil pos ma btab par mi bza' zhes pa ni 'di dag gi smad kyang chu bsil pos ma btab par zos na nyes byas su ston pa'o //
analyzed: zhag bdun pa dang nam 'tsho ba dang chu bsil pos ma btab par mi bza' zhes pa ni 'di dag gi smad kyang chu bsil pos ma btab par zos na nyes byas su ston pa'o //
translated: Not eating without sprinkling cool water on the remainder of these is taught as a fault if one eats without sprinkling cool water on the remainder of these.

original: thun gyi yang 'dis ma lhad par ma yin zhes pa ni rgun chu la sogs pa'i thun gyi skom yang chu bsil pos ma bsres par 'thungs na nyes byas su ston pa'o //
analyzed: thun gyi yang 'dis ma lhad par ma yin zhes pa ni rgun chu la sogs pa'i thun gyi skom yang chu bsil pos ma bsres par 'thungs na nyes byas su ston pa'o //
translated: Not drinking without mixing with this is taught as a fault if one drinks a drink of grape juice, etc., without mixing it with cool water.

original: sa bon dang 'khrung ba 'joms pa'o /
analyzed: sa bon dang 'khrung ba 'joms pa'o /
translated: It is the destruction of seeds and sprouts.

original: // / @102b 'phya ba'i ltung ba ston par 'dod pa ni /
analyzed: // / @102b 'phya ba'i ltung ba ston par 'dod pa ni /
translated: Desiring to teach the downfall of contempt, he says,

original: gang zag bcu gnyis las byed ces pa la sogs pa yin te gang zag bcu gnyis la 'phya na ltung bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang zag bcu gnyis las byed ces pa la sogs pa yin te gang zag bcu gnyis la 'phya na ltung bar byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúContempt for the twelve persons,‚Äù etc. Contempt for the twelve persons is a downfall.

original: de bcu gnyis gang nye gnas dang zas bsko ba dang thug pa dang bca' ba 'god pa dang gang ji yang rung ba 'brim pa dang snod spyad sped pa dang / gos 'god pa dang / dbyar gyi ras chen sbed pa dang / 'god pa dang sko blag byed pa mdzes 'tshes rnams so //
analyzed: de bcu gnyis gang nye gnas dang zas bsko ba dang thug pa dang bca' ba 'god pa dang gang ji yang rung ba 'brim pa dang snod spyad sped pa dang / gos 'god pa dang / dbyar gyi ras chen sbed pa dang / 'god pa dang sko blag byed pa mdzes 'tshes rnams so //
translated: These twelve are: the attendant, the assigner of meals, the assigner of rice gruel, the assigner of cooked vegetables, the assigner of whatever is available, the assigner of utensils, the assigner of robes, the assigner of the rainy season robes, the assigner of the rainy season robe-cloth, the assigner of the rainy season robe-cloth, the assigner of the rainy season robe-cloth, and the assigner of the rainy season robe-cloth.

original: bcu gnyis po 'di dag nyi tshe las nyes par 'gyur bar yang ma zad kyi chur ba dang 'bras 'god pa la sogs pa dge 'dun gyis bskos pa gzhan las kyang nyes par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: bcu gnyis po 'di dag nyi tshe las nyes par 'gyur bar yang ma zad kyi chur ba dang 'bras 'god pa la sogs pa dge 'dun gyis bskos pa gzhan las kyang nyes par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Not only are these twelve offenses, but also offenses are committed in relation to others appointed by the Sa·πÖgha, such as the assigner of curd and rice.

original: sbyor ba btang ba dang bskos pa ma yin kyang ngo zhes pa ni gang zag bcu gnyis kyi las las 'byung ba dang / gsol ba dang gnyis kyi las kyis bskos pa ma yin pa la dpyas na yang nyes par 'gyur bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba btang ba dang bskos pa ma yin kyang ngo zhes pa ni gang zag bcu gnyis kyi las las 'byung ba dang / gsol ba dang gnyis kyi las kyis bskos pa ma yin pa la dpyas na yang nyes par 'gyur bar ston pa'o //
translated: Even if the preparation is relinquished and one is not appointed, there is an offense. This teaches that there is an offense even if the preparation is relinquished and one is not appointed by the Sa·πÖgha through a two-part formal procedure.

original: ji ltar byas pas 'di'i nyes par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar byas pas 'di'i nyes par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does one commit an offense by doing this?

original: bdag gi phyir des thos par 'phya'am gzhogs 'phyas byed na'o zhes pa yin te bdag nyid de dag gi ngo ma bsnyams shing bsnyams las bcad pa skad du dor 'phya'am klog na gzhog sa 'phyas byed na yang nyes pa rangs par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: bdag gi phyir des thos par 'phya'am gzhogs 'phyas byed na'o zhes pa yin te bdag nyid de dag gi ngo ma bsnyams shing bsnyams las bcad pa skad du dor 'phya'am klog na gzhog sa 'phyas byed na yang nyes pa rangs par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It is said, If one is jealous of them for one's own sake, or if one is envious of them for one's own sake, because one does not consider oneself equal to them, and if one rejects the recitation of the vows, or if one reads them, or if one is envious of them, one will be fully at fault.

original: gang gi tshe rtsa ba'i nyes par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rtsa ba'i nyes par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: When does one become guilty of a root downfall?

original: bgrangs na rtsa ba'o zhes pa yin te kha gzan cing mi bgrungs par bgrangs su zin kyang dpyas byed na rtsa ba'i nyes par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: bgrangs na rtsa ba'o zhes pa yin te kha gzan cing mi bgrungs par bgrangs su zin kyang dpyas byed na rtsa ba'i nyes par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It is said, If one counts them, it is a root downfall, because even if one counts them in a disrespectful and unruly manner, one will become guilty of a root downfall if one is envious of them.

original: gzhan du na nyes byas zhes pa ni gong ma ltar bgrangs pa ma yin pas dpyas byas na nyes byas su ston pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan du na nyes byas zhes pa ni gong ma ltar bgrangs pa ma yin pas dpyas byas na nyes byas su ston pa'o //
translated: Otherwise, it is said, a minor offense, because if one does not count them as above, one is shown to be guilty of a minor offense if one is envious of them.

original: chung zad kyang khyad du gsod mi nus pa mi mngag ces pa ni mi gsar nga zhing bze re can las su mi bsgo zhing gar yang ma mngag shig pa'o //
analyzed: chung zad kyang khyad du gsod mi nus pa mi mngag ces pa ni mi gsar nga zhing bze re can las su mi bsgo zhing gar yang ma mngag shig pa'o //
translated: One should not employ anyone who cannot be despised in the least, meaning that one should not employ anyone who is not a novice, who is not arrogant, and who is not sent anywhere.

original: khon pa bdag gi las su mi bsko zhes pa ni bdag dang khon yod pa las su bsko ba'i tshe bdag nyid kyis ma bsko bar gzhan las spring zhing bsgo shig pa'o //
analyzed: khon pa bdag gi las su mi bsko zhes pa ni bdag dang khon yod pa las su bsko ba'i tshe bdag nyid kyis ma bsko bar gzhan las spring zhing bsgo shig pa'o //
translated: Do not appoint me as a messenger to convey a message to an enemy means that when one is appointed to convey a message to an enemy, one should not do it oneself, but should assign it to another.

original: 'phya ba'o / //
analyzed: 'phya ba'o / //
translated: It is a slander.

original: / bsgo ba'i lan log par ldog pa'i ltung ba je ston pa ni mi'i thog mar bgrang ba'i mtshan nyid ston pa ni /
analyzed: / bsgo ba'i lan log par ldog pa'i ltung ba je ston pa ni mi'i thog mar bgrang ba'i mtshan nyid ston pa ni /
translated: The downfall of giving a reply to an order in a wrong way is presented in the following verse, which shows the characteristics of the first human being to be counted.

original: glengs pa'i tshig dang rnegs pas mi nyan pa smras pa'i gang zag rnams la ngor zog pa dang gzhogs 'phyas byed pa rnams mi bgrang ba ma yin te 'di dag ltar byas pa'i gang zag kha gzan cing mi bgrungs par grongs shig pa'o //
analyzed: glengs pa'i tshig dang rnegs pas mi nyan pa smras pa'i gang zag rnams la ngor zog pa dang gzhogs 'phyas byed pa rnams mi bgrang ba ma yin te 'di dag ltar byas pa'i gang zag kha gzan cing mi bgrungs par grongs shig pa'o //
translated: It is not that one should not count those who, when spoken to, do not listen and speak with contempt and side comments. One should think, May the person who acts like this die, be despised, and be uncouth!

original: de la glengs pa'i tshig mi nyan pa ni tshig gzhan du brgyud pa'o //üîΩrnegs @103a * //
analyzed: de la glengs pa'i tshig mi nyan pa ni tshig gzhan du brgyud pa'o // rnegs @103a * //
translated: Not listening with words means to speak in a roundabout way.

original: pas mi nyan ba ni glengs pa'i tshe dngan 'then byed cing mi smra ba'o //
analyzed: pas mi nyan ba ni glengs pa'i tshe dngan 'then byed cing mi smra ba'o //
translated: Not listening with a haughty mind means to sigh when spoken to and to remain silent.

original: smras pa'i gang zag ces pa ni gang zag bcu gnyis gong du bstan pa rnams la bya'o //
analyzed: smras pa'i gang zag ces pa ni gang zag bcu gnyis gong du bstan pa rnams la bya'o //
translated: The person who is spoken of is the twelve types of persons taught above.

original: gsol bas so zhes pa ni gong du smos pa'i bgrang ba de gsol bas bgrang zhing 'god gtod du phyung shig pa'o //
analyzed: gsol bas so zhes pa ni gong du smos pa'i bgrang ba de gsol bas bgrang zhing 'god gtod du phyung shig pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúby‚Äù means that one should count and set forth the enumeration mentioned above.

original: ji ltar byas pas bsgo ba'i lan log par ldon pa'i ltung bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar byas pas bsgo ba'i lan log par ldon pa'i ltung bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does one commit the downfall of giving a reply that is contrary to the instruction?

original: dge slong gi tshig mi nyan no //
analyzed: dge slong gi tshig mi nyan no //
translated: One does not listen to the words of the monks.

original: zhes pa yin te dge slong dag gi chos kyi tshig bsgo zhing glengs so cog mi nyan na rtsa ba'i nyes par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: zhes pa yin te dge slong dag gi chos kyi tshig bsgo zhing glengs so cog mi nyan na rtsa ba'i nyes par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If one does not listen to the words of the Dharma of the monks, whatever they may be, one commits a root downfall.

original: 'di'ang ji lta bu'i bsam pas she na /
analyzed: 'di'ang ji lta bu'i bsam pas she na /

original: ji lta bus mi nyan ce na /
analyzed: ji lta bus mi nyan ce na /

analyzed: mi dran no zhe na yang ngo zhes pa ni bsnyon na yang nyes byas su ston pa'o //

analyzed: mi smra ba dang gzhan du smras so cog nyes par 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: If one does not speak, or speaks otherwise, is there an offense?üîΩ If the speech is not harmful, there is no offense.

translated: If the speech is harmful, such as slander, there is no offense if one does not speak, or speaks otherwise, because it would be harmful and unpleasant for that person.

original: de lta bas na gsad pa mthong ba 'dri na je sros chu je 'thungs ngal je sos /
analyzed: de lta bas na gsad pa mthong ba 'dri na je sros chu je 'thungs ngal je sos /

analyzed: shes pa dang nam mkha' dang sen mo mthong ngo //

analyzed: yang dag par na sems can nam gsod pa ma mthong ngo zhes smras pa nyes med ces pa ni gsad pa gshed ma mis zhed de 'dri ba'i tshe'ang 'di skad du brgyud cing lan ldon pas blan du zin kyang nyes med par ston pa ste smra ba gnod

original: par 'gyur ba ni 'di lta bu'o //
analyzed: par 'gyur ba ni 'di lta bu'o //

analyzed: rin po che la reg go cog gis nyes par 'gyur ram zhe na /

analyzed: gtsug lag khang dang de'i nye spyod du gyur la bdag gir bya ba dang mi ldan zhing nor chud mi gzan pa'i sems kyis na ma gtogs so zhes pa ni ri dags dgra'i ma sa ga'i rgyan lus la 'phags pa kun dga' bos rnyed pa lta bu yin

translated: If in the abode of non-humans, if born by merit, jeweled ground, steps, etc. are faultless, means that when one arrives at the abode of nagas and so forth, if all the bases, etc. are made of jewels,

analyzed: theg pas 'gro zhes pa ni rta dang glang po la sogs pa'i theg pa la zhon cig pa'o ;
